items.title: 'Moving more and more into a post-React world.'
items.content:
#â€‹564 â€” November 12, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

'Rust is the Future of JavaScript Infrastructure' â€” Itâ€™s an opinion but the growing evidence is compelling. Rust (as well as Go) is now being heavily used to replace parts of the JavaScript tooling ecosystem that might have otherwise been written in JavaScript before (e.g. Rome, SWC, dprint).

Lee Robinson

Airbnb's Extensive JavaScript Style Guide â€” Itâ€™s been a few years since we mentioned this hugely popular, opinionated style guide, but it continues to get frequent updates/fixes and the first major update (v19) in two years has just beenÂ tagged.

Airbnb

Manage the Stability of Your Electron Apps withÂ Bugsnag â€” Capture JavaScript and native errors with end-to-end error reporting and diagnostics to fix the errors that matter and streamline user experience. LearnÂ more.

Bugsnag sponsor

Vercel Hires Rich Harris, Creator of Svelte â€” â€˜Person gets jobâ€™ isnâ€™t the most obviously interesting story out there, but when itâ€™s the creator of Svelte (and someone who has â–¶ï¸ lots of great insights on how webapps should be built) joining a platform that will enable him to focus even more strongly on the project, itâ€™s exciting as Rich himselfÂ says.

Guillermo Rauch

â€œNow that Svelte has full-time engineering resources, itâ€™s exciting to see accumulating evidence that things are moving more and more into a post-React world.â€

___
Zach Leatherman (creator of Eleventy)

Bundle Scanner: Identify npm Libraries Used on a Web Page â€” Enter a URL and this tool will try and show you what npm packages were used in the pageâ€™s JavaScript even if theyâ€™re all bundled up. Thereâ€™s an explanation of how it works. Or some example results for Kent C Doddâ€™s fancy new homepage.

Markus Englund

ğŸ“† Â JavaScript Marathon: A Week of Free Online Courses/Talks â€” Between November 15-19 (thatâ€™s next Monday to Friday), several JavaScript developers are giving online workshops on things like NgRx, GraphQL, XState, andÂ Vite.

This Dot Labs

RELEASES:

RxDB 10.4 â€“ Realtime database for JS apps.
Cypress 9.0 â€“ Test framework for anything browser-based.
Deno 1.16 â€“ It's definitely not Node.
Intro.js 4.3 â€“ User onboarding UI library.
htmlparser2 v7.2 â€“ Forgiving HTML and XML parser.
React Router v6
Angular DevTools 1.0.4

ğŸ’» Jobs

Backend Engineer (Remote, EU Timezones) â€” Weâ€™ve built a product thousands of people love (See Trustpilot if you donâ€™t believe us). We need your help with Node &Â TypeScript.
Feather

Software Engineer at Carbon Five (LA / SF / NYC / CHA) â€” Hiring full-stack developers at all levels to join our team of creative consultants. New tech, great clients, growth opps &Â more.
Carbon Five

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

The Invisible JavaScript Backdoor â€” Itâ€™s one thing if you can read some code to discover sneaky backdoors, but what if the code looks totally fine, yet really itâ€™s not? Invisible Unicode characters make it possible as we see (or not) here. One mitigation against this is to have your editor highlight such troublesome characters such as with the Gremlins extension for VS Code or SublimeÂ Text.

Wolfgang Ettlinger

Developer-First Infrastructure Using JavaScript and Pulumi â€” Build, deploy, and manage modern cloud applications and infrastructure using JavaScript. Get started forÂ free.

Pulumi sponsor

How to Toggle Dark Mode on a Page with a (Literal) Blink â€” Itâ€™s arguable how useful this specific use case for Tensorflow.js is, but itâ€™s interesting, works quite well (for me.. even with glasses on), and could lead you on to otherÂ things.

Ankur Kedia

Earning $1.5M in Revenue from a JavaScript Component â€” I know some of you love the occasional entrepreneurial story and maybe Marcin Warpechowski of Handsontable will inspire you withÂ his.

Indie Hackers

Node-RED in Industrial IoT: A Growing Standard â€” Node-RED is a long standing Node.js-based â€˜low codeâ€™ environment where you wire components together and itâ€™s taking on established commercial systems in the industrialÂ world.

United Manufacturing Hub

Beyond onClick: Handling Events in React

Lightstep sponsor

How to Speed Up Your TypeScript Monorepo with esbuild
Matteo Mazzarolo

Localizing Your Next.js App: The Basics
Ãtila Fassina

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Splide: Lightweight and Accessible Slider/Carousel â€” Itâ€™s nice to see a clean, modern spin on the often maligned UI element. The homepage is packed with demos too. No dependencies, written in TypeScript, and boasts a clean report from Lighthouse. GitHubÂ repo.

Naotoshi Fujita

Vuestic 1.3.0: A Free and Open Source UI Library for Vue 3 â€” Some data tables have been added, along with a timeÂ picker.

Epicmax

Liqe: Lightweight Lucene-like Parser and Search Engine â€” Lets you use Lucene-style search query syntax to query or test things you have in JavaScript objects. InterestingÂ idea.

Gajus Kuizinas

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

MiniMasonry.js: Minimalist Dependancy Free Masonry LayoutÂ Library â€” â€˜Masonryâ€™ layouts are where you get a wall-style effect on pages with elements laid out in strictly defined columns (or rows, sometimes).

Spope

Meet Hydrogen: Shopify's React Framework for Dynamic, Contextual and Personalized E-Commerce â€” Hydrogen is an in-development React framework bringing tech like Server Components and Vite into play for building custom stores on Shopify's ecommerceÂ platform.

Ilya Grigorik (Shopify)

Bree 7.0: A Versatile Job Scheduler for Node â€” Supports cron, dates, ms, later, and human-friendly for scheduling things. Made to help run Forward Email. GitHubÂ repo.

Nick Baugh

hashids.js: Small Library to Generate YouTube Style IDs fromÂ Numbers â€” If you donâ€™t want to expose numeric IDs to end users, this is an interestingÂ option.

Bazyli BrzÃ³ska

Vant: 65+ Lightweight Mobile UI Components Built with Vue andÂ TypeScript
youzan

items.title: Angular 13, V8 9.7, and Puppeteer 11
items.content:
#â€‹563 â€” November 5, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Chrome's New Feature to Record and Replay User Flows â€” Itâ€™s only a preview feature in Canary builds right now, but Chrome is adding a new Recorder panel to its DevTools which lets you record and replay a string of actions on a page (including under simulated slow network conditions). You can also measure the flow and get a performance trace forÂ analysis.

Jecelyn Yeen (Google)

Angular 13 Released â€” Despite sentiment on social media, Angular continues to be a hugely popular framework, particularly in enterprise situations and v13 continues to push things forward with more of the Ivy related improvements comingÂ through.

Mark Thompson

Another Bug Bites the Dust â€” AppSignal is an easy-to-use error and performance monitoring tool. We support the most popular Node.js frameworks and packages out-of-the-box. All features are included in all plans. Start a trial and send us your address for a box of DutchÂ cookies.

AppSignal sponsor

Microsoft Brings (More) JavaScript to Excel â€” At its latest Ignite conference, Microsoft unveiled an Excel update (currently in â€˜previewâ€™) that introduces a new JavaScript API for creating custom data types and functions based on them. More detailsÂ here.

TechCrunch

Announcing TypeScript 4.5 RC â€” The first release candidate of TypeScript 4.5 is here with no changes now expected before the final release. Weâ€™ll focus more on the final release but a big change with this RC is deferring the promised ESM support forÂ Node.js.

Daniel Rosenwasser and the TypeScript Team

QUICK BITS:

  • The V8 team has created the V8 v9.7 branch which introduces two new Array methods (findLast and findLastIndex) without needing a flag.

  • Two more npm packages have had malicious code injected by hijackers, this time it's coa and rc, both of which get millions of downloads per week.

  • Jeremy Wagner has written and now published, with A Book Apart, a new book called ResponsibleÂ JavaScript.

  • Nat Friedman, who has been a fantastic steward and CEO for GitHub since its acquisition by Microsoft, is moving on and handing the reins over to ThomasÂ Dohmke.

  • Talking of GitHub, if you fancy building a game in JavaScript consider joining their Game Off 2021 event â€“ you get till December 1 to submit an entry.

RELEASES:

Visual Studio Code (October) â€“ Light on JS updates this time.
axios-hooks 3.0 â€“ React hooks for Axios.
Recoil 0.5.0 â€“ Experimental React state management library.
Marked 4.0 â€“ Markdown parser and compiler.
jqGrid 5.6 â€“ jQuery tabular data grid plugin.
Rollup 2.59.0 â€“ ES module bundler.
Puppeteer 11 â€“ Headless Chrome Node.js API.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

â–¶Â Â Have Single-Page Apps Ruined the Web? â€” The creator of frontend framework Svelte talks about the criticisms lodged towards single-page apps and how â€˜transitional appsâ€™ may be the wayÂ forward. Lots of good insights here that will probably make you feel a bit smarterÂ afterwardÂ too.

Rich Harris

Developer Tools Secrets That Shouldnâ€™t Be Secrets â€” An Edge-focused look at console power tips, how to use browser developer tools outside the browser, andÂ more.

Christian Heilmann

Visualizing Time Series Data with the Highcharts Library and InfluxDB â€” Learn how to use Highcharts library to understand and act on IoT data in this hands-onÂ tutorial.

InfluxData sponsor

Creating the Effect of Transparent Glass and Plastic with Three.js â€” The effects you can pull off in the browser nowadays continue to impress me as someone who grew up on 8-bit graphics(!) ;-)

Kelly Milligan

How to Show/Hide Elements in Vue â€” How to use v-if, v-show and :class to show/hide elements inÂ Vue.

Dmitri Pavlutin

â–¶Â Â What is Astro? â€” Drew McLellan talks to developer Matthew Phillips about the modern static site builder.

Smashing Podcast podcast

Best Practices for Embedding Third-Party Web Widgets
Ravidu Perera

Proxying Third-Party JavaScript as First-Party JavaScript (and the Potential Effect onÂ Analytics)
Chris Coyier

How to Deploy a Vue.js 3 App on Azure Static Web Apps
Obinna Odirionye

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Hasty: A JavaScript Snippet Perfomance Comparison Tool â€” A quick, easy-to-use online tool that lets you test variations of a particular snippet to see which one performs best. A bit like jsPerf from the oldÂ day, or other tools like perf.link andÂ jsBench.

Mads Cordes

Coding Font: A 'Game' to Find Your New Favorite Code Font â€” This is a fun idea. It throws over 25 popular developer-oriented fonts into a â€˜tournamentâ€™ and you then pick your favorites until youâ€™re left with a winner. (It was JetBrains Mono forÂ me.)

Typogram

Dynamic Charts Based on Data Selection in Angular â€” Ever had users asking to be able to generate their own charts? This tutorial shows you how easy it can be with Kendo UI forÂ Angular.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

History: An API to Manage Session History with JavaScript â€” The getting started docs give a great look at why and where youâ€™d useÂ this.

Remix

Depp: Check npm Modules for Unused and Duplicate DependenciesÂ Fast â€” A new Go-powered tool you run from your JavaScript/TypeScript projectâ€™s folder to look for unusedÂ dependencies.

Rahul Tarak

Prisma 3.4.0 Released: The Popular 'Next Gen' ORM and Toolset â€” PostgreSQL 14 support is a key feature, plus support for using orderBy with aggregate groups in MongoDB, as well as the usual tweaks and bugÂ fixes.

Prisma

Smooth Scrollbar: Flexible, Customizable Scrollbars â€” I quite like that it advises you not to use it unless â€œyou know what you are doingâ€ â€“ good advice considering how it can make navigating a page â€˜feelâ€™ different. Try the demoÂ page.

Daofeng Wu

Catch Errors in Your Complex Regular Expressions with SonarLint

SonarLint sponsor

A Script to Export Photoshop Layers to Individual Files Fast â€” This caught my interest as Iâ€™ve done some scripting in Adobe apps before. It uses an unusual dialect of ECMAScript called â€˜ExtendScriptâ€™ (hence the confusing .jsx extension on the scripts) but you can get a lot done with it, as demonstratedÂ here.

Hanna

Detox: 'Gray Box' End-to-End Testing and Automation Framework for Mobile Apps â€” Tests your mobile app while itâ€™s running in a real device/simulator, interacting with it just like a real user â€“ you write the scripts inÂ JavaScript.

Wix

CachedLookup: A Simple Package to Cache and Save on Expensive API Calls
Kartik

items.title: A quick way to clean up node_modules folders
items.content:
#â€‹562 â€” October 29, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Tabulator 5.0: An Interactive Table and Data Grid Library â€” Supports all major browsers and can be used with Angular, Vue, and React if you wish. 5.0 is a big release boasting a complete rebuild, restructuring and moving to ES modules â€“ see the 5.0 release notes. A huge number of examplesÂ awaitÂ too.

Oli Folkerd

Next.js 12 Released â€” The popular Node.js + React development framework takes a big step forward with improvements including beta support for middleware, native ES module support, and a Rust-powered compiler for 5x faster builds, andÂ more.

The Vercel Team

Shortcut Is Project Management Without theÂ Management â€” Whether you're a startup that iterates quickly by giving engineers a free pallet of Red Bull, or a large org that has strict ship dates to hit, Shortcut is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, andÂ reporting.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Why 'Outdated' jQuery Is Still The Dominant JavaScript Library â€” jQuery is one of the longest running and most influential JavaScript libraries on the web. How has it stood the test ofÂ time?

Richard MacManus

How ua-parser-js, An npm Package with 8M+ Weekly Downloads, Was Compromised â€” UAParser.js is a library for detecting browsers, JS engines, OS, and other things from user agents. The problem was quickly fixed, but the package was briefly infiltrated with malware. The maintainer and others shared more in this GitHubÂ issue.

The Daily Swig

QUICK BITS:

  • Node 16 (codenamed 'Gallium') has gone LTS with its v16.13.0 release. Node 17 is now the one getting all the cutting edge features.

  • Facebook (or is that Meta now?) is taking steps to making Hermes, its mobile-focused JS engine, the default engine for React Native.

  • RIP Bill Scott who had a big influence on the growth of the Node space in its early years.

  • ğŸ“… React Conf 2021 is taking place online this yearÂ â€“Â it's free, and it's on December 8.

RELEASES:

Yarn 3.1 â€“ Alternative package manager.
Solid 1.2.0 â€“ Reactive UI library.
MUI-Datatables 4.0 â€“ Material UI-based data table for React.
ESLint 8.1.0 â€“ JS code analyzer.
GoldenLayout 2.4.0 â€“ Multi-window layout manager for webapps.
Meteor 2.5
Redux 4.1.2

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Backend Engineer (Remote, EU Timezones) â€” Weâ€™ve built a product thousands of people love (See Trustpilot if you donâ€™t believe us). We need your help with Node &Â TypeScript.
Feather

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

Adobe Photoshop's Journey to the Web â€” Weâ€™ve had pretty good graphics editors in the browser before, but bringing the pieces together to have an editor worthy of the Photoshop name is a feat. WebAssembly played a huge role, but so did many other Web technologies, and they collectively open up new opportunities for us all â€“ not justÂ Adobe.

Thomas Nattestad and Nabeel Al-Shamma

â–¶Â Â How to Do TypeScript Without TypeScript â€” Static types confer numerous benefits when developing, but is it necessary to use TypeScript fully in order to get many of the benefits? Simone investigates the pros and cons and shows off an alternativeÂ approach.

Simone Sanfratello

Develop a Faster Way to Work. Build Internal Tools, RemarkablyÂ Fast â€” Custom dashboards, admin panels, CRUD appsâ€”build any internal tool faster in Retool. Get started for freeÂ today.

Retool sponsor

On Building an Effective Image Component for Next.js â€” The story of an out-of-the-box solution to optimize images for Next.js. It optimizes loading, compression & responsiveness. Now with AVIF support in Next.jsÂ 12.

Sohoni, Erickson, Castle

What Every JavaScript Developer Should Know About Unicode â€” Itâ€™s not new, but has been doing the rounds on social again and is packed with useful knowledge about how strings are represented, why Unicode exists, what code units are, and then how JavaScript tackles itÂ all.

Dmitri Pavlutin

In-Page Filtered Search with Vanilla JavaScript â€” I tend to jump to Cmd+F for my in-page searching needs, but if you want to offer something a little more elegant and custom, this sort of approach canÂ help.

Hilman Ramadhan

Reflection at Reflect: The Reflect and Proxy APIs â€” Reflect is a tool for working with regression tests, and it uses JavaScriptâ€™s own Reflect and Proxy objects to gain access to the info it needs fromÂ code.

Reflect

Build a Mobile-Responsive Telehealth Pager App Using Streamâ€™s Chat API

Stream sponsor

Trie in JavaScript: The Data Structure Behind 'Autocomplete'
Anish Kumar

Sparse vs Dense Arrays in JavaScript
Dmitri Pavlutin

How to Generate Beautiful PDFs with React and Puppeteer
ClÃ©ment Marcilhacy

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Cytoscape.js: A Graph Theory/Network Library for Visualization andÂ Analysis â€” Handy if you need to model and/or visualize relational data, like biological data or social networks. There are so many demos to enjoy here. GitHubÂ repo.

Max Franz

PDFKit: A PDF Generation Library for Node and Browser â€” Thereâ€™s an interesting live demo that runs right in the browser. GitHubÂ repo.

Devon Govett

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints andÂ console.log.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Blobity: Level Up Your Cursor Game â€” This script and API lets you do all sorts of creative things with the userâ€™s cursor, which the page itself demonstrates. Note that itâ€™s free for open-source projectsÂ only.

Georgy Marchuk

Vizzu: A Library for Animated Data Visualizations and DataÂ Stories â€” Vizzu is a little different to most data visualization libraries in the sense that animating the visualizations and transforming between different visualization types is the keyÂ focus.

Vizzu

Fragstore: A Tiny (~800 Byte) and Simple Library to Manage React State
Aral Roca Gomez

ğŸ†Â Golden Oldie of the Week

Whenever someone mentions this on Twitter, it still gets lots of likes and rewteets so there's clearly plenty of people who either haven't seen it or want to remember it exists ğŸ˜‚ It might be useful when you're feeling a bit short of disk space..

npkill: Easily Remove Old or 'Heavy' node_modules Folders â€” List any node_modules directories in your system, as well as the space they take up. You can then select which ones you want to erase to free upÂ space. GitHubÂ repo.

Nya GarcÃ­a and Juan Torres

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  








  
  
Tabulator 5.0: An Interactive Table and Data Grid Library â€” Supports all major browsers and can be used with Angular, Vue, and React if you wish. 5.0 is a big release boasting a complete rebuild, restructuring and moving to ES modules â€“ see the 5.0 release notes. A huge number of examplesÂ awaitÂ too.
Oli Folkerd 


  
  
Next.js 12 Released â€” The popular Node.js + React development framework takes a big step forward with improvements including beta support for middleware, native ES module support, and a Rust-powered compiler for 5x faster builds, andÂ more.
The Vercel Team 


  
  
Shortcut Is Project Management Without theÂ Management â€” Whether you're a startup that iterates quickly by giving engineers a free pallet of Red Bull, or a large org that has strict ship dates to hit, Shortcut is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, andÂ reporting.
Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

items.title: Gatsby 4 released
items.content:
#â€‹561 â€” October 22, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Whatâ€™s New in the Now Fully Released Gatsby 4 â€” Gatsby is a popular React-based open-source framework and v4 introduces new content rendering methods (such as Deferred Static Generation), React 18 future proofing, new build and deployment architecture, new CMS APIs, andÂ more.

Jeff James (Gatsby)

Node v17 (Current) Released â€” Just six months after its release, Node v16 prepares to become an 'active LTS' release to be maintained until 2024, with v17 now taking up the role as the cutting edge release that gets all the new features first. It includes OpenSSL 3.0, V8 9.5, npm 8.1.0, and more.

Bethany Nicolle Griggs and the Node.js Team

No DKIM, No SPF, No WTF. Transactional Emails Sent via Gmail â€” Transactional email providers lack certain features that leave us with more work than when we started. Save time with our API, routing rules, and template designer. Start sending for free in seconds. Get $5,000 in credits towards your enterpriseÂ plan.

Courier sponsor

Over 100 Algorithms and Data Structures Demonstrated in JS â€” Examples of many common algorithms (e.g. bit manipulation, Pascalâ€™s triangle, Hamming distance) and data structures (e.g. linked lists, tries, graphs) with explanations. Available in other languages too like Chinese, Korean, French, andÂ Spanish.

Oleksii Trekhleb et al.

QUICK BITS:

  • beta.reactjs.org gives a first look at a new approach for the official React docs. Check out the Quick Start tutorial page to really see it in action.

  • Chrome 95 has been released this week and here's what's new for developers.

  • On the latest episode of his bite size Q&A podcast, Kent C Dodds talks about â–¶ï¸Â why he uses XState (the state machine library) on his site.

  • âš›ï¸ If you're a React developer, make sure you're also on our React Status newsletter as that's where we put the lion's share of React items we find each weekÂ :-)

  • Playwright 1.16 â€“ the Node library to automate browsers â€“ has been released including a new API testing feature.

  • The Angular team has published an RFC for an architectural shift within the framework with the goal to make Angular simpler to use, and moreÂ modular.

RELEASES:

Neutralinojs 3.0 â€“ X-platform app dev framework. Lighter than Electron.
React Bootstrap 2.0 â€“ Bootstrap components built with React.
Commander.js 8.3.0 â€“ CLI niceties for Node.js.
noVNC 1.3.0 â€“ JS and HTML-based VNC client for browsers.
React Native Testing Library 8.0
Node-RED 2.1.1 â€“ Low-code JS dev environment.

ğŸ’» Jobs

[EU] JavaScript Developer, Preferably with React Knowledge â€” New hires get a "buddy" who will guide you through the company, code and the process. Newest technologies, development possibilities and satisfactionÂ :)
LastMinute.com

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

â–¶Â Â Implementing a 'Candy Crush' Game with React â€” The latest of Aniaâ€™s no-nonsense all-about-the-code screencasts walking through the creation of a simple puzzleÂ game.

Ania KubÃ³w

Understanding Map and Set in JavaScript â€” Goes over the Map and Set objects, what makes them similar or different to Objects and Arrays, the properties and methods available to them, and examples of some practicalÂ uses.

Tania Rascia

Get Started with JavaScript and InfluxDB 2.0 â€” Monitor your JavaScript application performance and create beautiful web-based visualizations withÂ InfluxDB.

InfluxData sponsor

How to Cancel an HTTP Request in Node.js â€” The Abort API allows you to cancel asynchronous tasks such as in-flight HTTP requests and hereâ€™s how to use it in the latest Node.jsÂ version.

Simon Plenderleith

How to Create a Linear Gauge Chart in JavaScript â€” A way to visualize progress, perhaps - as used here to show off COVID vaccinationÂ rates.

Shachee Swadia

â–¶Â Â How to Create a PWA With Next.js in 10 Minutes â€” Congratulations to James for just earning his 100K YouTube PlayÂ button.

James Q Quick

Use console.log() Like a Pro â€” Always nice to have a reminder of the various console methods forÂ debugging.

Marko Denic

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the â€œCanâ€ in Kanban

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Six Tips To Make Your Pull Requests Easier toÂ Review â€” Looking to have your pull request rise above the background noise for an active repo?

Chak Shun Yu

How to Create CSS Custom Properties That Dynamically Update with React and JS
Colby Fayock

Building an API with Gatsby Functions
Paul Scanlon

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

LittleJS: A Tiny 2D JavaScript Game Engine with Fast WebGLÂ Rendering â€” No dependencies and it claims to render 10,000+ objects atÂ 60fps.

Frank Force

memoize-one 6.0: A Memoization Library with a Simple Approach â€” A memoization library that takes the curious approach of only remembering the last invocation and arguments, returning the cached value if the next call matches. This saves on complex caching arrangements while speeding up manyÂ scenarios.

Alex Reardon

ChordSymbol: Musical Chord Parser and Renderer â€” Claims to be able to â€œhandle whatever chord syntaxâ€ you throw at it and it can generate all the notes to be displayed elsewhere. GitHubÂ repo.

Christophe NoÃ«l

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

GistPad: VS Code Extension for Managing Code Snippets in GitHubÂ Gists â€” Allows you to manage GitHub Gists entirely within VS Code. Open, create, delete, fork, star, and clone gists, then go straight to editing. VS MarketplaceÂ link.

VS Live Share Contrib

JavaScript Obfuscator: A Way to 'Scramble' JS Code â€” Transforms your code into a functionally equivalent representation thatâ€™s harder to understand or modify. Many folks find this sort of fiddling to be of low value given it can be reversed to some extent, but thereâ€™s a Web interface if you want to have aÂ go.

Timofey Kachalov, Tiago Serafim, et al.

OpenSilver 1.0: A Modern, Plugin-Free Reimplementation ofÂ Silverlight â€” This is a replacement for Microsoftâ€™s lonnnng deprecated Silverlight technology, but as of this 1.0 release boasts being â€œpowerful enough to run complex line-of-business applications of all sizes.â€ Itâ€™s open-source and runs in current browsers viaÂ WebAssembly.

Userware

Pdfvuer: A PDF Viewer for Vue, Powered by Mozilla's PDF.js
Gaurav Koley

Hyperactiv 0.9: A Super Tiny Reactive Library
Julien Elbaz

Dust.js 3.0: Asynchronous JS Templating for Browser and Server
LinkedIn

reveal-md: Create Reveal.js Presentations from Markdown Files
Lars Kappert

Cacheables: Simple In-Memory Cache with Automatic Invalidation and ElegantÂ Syntax
Grischa Erbe

ğŸ¤“Â And one for fun..

(t,i,x,y) => 'creative code golfing' â€” Tixy is a neat little creative coding environment where you're given a simple 16x16 grid of dots and you can manipulate them via small slices of JavaScript. Math.random() is a fun one to chuckÂ in.

Martin Kleppe

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
